sentences.en: Accelerators also used for radioisotope production, cancer therapy, Biological sterilization, and one form of radiocarbon dating.
sentences.cn: 加速器也用于制造放射性同位素 、 治疗癌症 、 生物消毒及放射性碳定年.
所有生物都含有放射性碳.

sentences.en: Bacteria and bacterial residue carry additional carbon and would skew the radiocarbon date toward the present.
sentences.cn: 细菌和细菌性残余带来额外的碳,会使现时测定的年代变得不准确.

sentences.en: Researchers use radiocarbon to study certain biological processes.
sentences.cn: 研究人员借助放射性碳来研究某些生物过程.

sentences.en: The material in this beach has been dated by radiocarbon.
sentences.cn: 这个海滩上的物质经过放射性碳测定.

sentences.en: The most frequently used method is radiocarbon dating.
sentences.cn: 最常用的方法是放射性碳定年法。

sentences.en: The reliability of radiocarbon dating depends on the reliability of dating material.
sentences.cn: 14C年龄的可靠性在于测年物质的可靠.

words.tran_cn: 放射性；[核] 放射能力；[核] 放射现象
[核] 放射线照相术；X光线照相术

phrases.tran_cn: 放射性碳测定年代；碳同位素年龄测定

trans.tran_cn: 放射性碳，碳的放射性同位元素
trans.tran_en: Radiocarbon is a type of carbon that is radioactive, and which therefore breaks up slowly at a regular rate. Its presence in an object can be measured in order to find out how old the object is.
